title: Twitter, IAC, Nvidia, Conagra: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Twitter shares climb on deal report; Megacap tech stocks gain premarket
text:
Barry Diller's media conglomerate IAC/InteractiveCorp. climbed 2.5% after it reached a $2.7 billion deal to buy Meredith, a magazine publisher with brands such as People and InStyle. Meredith shares added 6.5%.

Megacap tech companies gained premarket as government bond yields edged down. Apple added 0.9%, Amazon.com gained 1.1% and Microsoft climbed 0.9%. Nvidia rose 2.2% and Square was up 2.9%.

Packaged foods maker Conagra Brands gained 2.4% premarket. It said said it expects higher inflation for its full year and plans to continue adjusting prices and taking cost-saving measures.

Tilray shares slipped 2.1% ahead of the bell after the cannabis company said its first-quarter net loss had widened.

Lamb Weston shares sank 8.5% after the potato-and-vegetable company reported fiscal first-quarter profit and sales that missed expectations.

Household and personal-care product maker Helen of Troy climbed 3.7% premarket after it raised its outlook for fiscal 2022.

Moderna edged down 1.1%. It put forward plans to build a vaccine-manufacturing plant in Africa. At Wednesday's close, the stock had lost over 20% of its value this month so far.

Accolade will report earnings after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Airline stocks have gained more than 10% over the past month, as broader equity markets tumbled. However, this is merely a partial rebound from a bad summer for aviation shares, including those of plane makers. Only budget-airline stocks currently trade above their pre-Covid levels.

Write to Anna Hirtenstein at anna.hirtenstein@wsj.com
